It sounds like you had an amazing time at the festival, and the Afro-Cuban rhythms workshop was a highlight for you! Learning from instructors who are from Cuba must have been a great experience, and dancing with Carlos was likely a fantastic opportunity to learn from someone with extensive knowledge and expertise.

It's wonderful that you're looking to attend more dance festivals and events that feature Afro-Cuban rhythms and Latin music. Not only will you get to learn from experienced instructors, but you'll also get to immerse yourself in the vibrant energy of the festival atmosphere.

If you're looking to find similar festivals or events, you might want to try searching for keywords like "Afro-Cuban dance festival," "Latin dance festival," "Cuban music festival," or "Salsa festival" along with your location or a nearby city. You can also try searching for events featuring specific instructors or dance companies that you're interested in.

Additionally, you might want to consider reaching out to the festival organizers or the instructors you met at the March 4th festival to see if they have any upcoming events or workshops planned. They might be able to give you insider information on upcoming festivals or events that you wouldn't want to miss!

Remember to keep an open mind and be willing to try new things – you never know what amazing experiences and opportunities might come your way!
